website_summaries.verdict: With extended instep protection, these synthetic leather guards give solid protection during both sparring and bagwork.
pros: Provides complete protection for shin and instep
Extended instep for greater foot protection
Easy to take on and off
Stiff, light and don't impede movement
cons: Some experience rubbing issues at the heel or in the "hinge" between the arch pad and upper shin

customer_reviews.title: Very good protection, but could be better...
customer_reviews.text: While these provide good protection for even fairly aggressive kicking sessions, the "hinge" between the arch pad and the upper portion of the shin guard starts to rub a raw spot against the area of skin immediately behind that part of the shin guard. If they corrected this, it would be a five-star rating. Otherwise, they're comfortable for even extended training sessions, are easy to don and doff, and have held up well after 10 weeks of heavy, several times a week training.
customer_reviews.author: Student of the Game

customer_reviews.title: Great Shinguards with 1 problem
customer_reviews.text: These Shinguards are awesome !! They are light, they are created and coated well with great materials, they a comfortable, they do not obstruct movement in any way and they not only cover the shin but also the sides of the leg. However, I have to give them 4 stars because the bottom wrap scratches your ankle skin pretty badly when sparring. I DO recommend these shingguards if you have the money for them but my advice is not to wear them without ankle guards/protectors or your skin will be damaged badly when sparring. Other than that these shinguards are high quality stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Allergic reaction to material
customer_reviews.text: I lightly used them (maybe 12 times) and had an allergic reaction on my shins. I decided to wash them and one ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For mma sparring, this is the go to shin guards.
customer_reviews.text: I do MMA and Muay Thai. For Muay Thai, I use top King shin guards. However for MMA, I prefer the SP5 fairtex. The reason being the protection it offers while also very light weight and does not interfere with a power double or any takedown requiring me to duck walk through. If reading this review and need shin guards for MMA, Buy the fairtex SP5. Don't waste $$ on brand hype or cheap gear. See quality gear as an investment in your hobby and most importantly ur health.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: High quality & great price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these not really confident in my ability to buy new gear my first time online but they are great! It is so much nicer to upgrade from my gym's standard sock shin guards, so now I can really spar without feeling *as* much pain. I do find that the foot area is kind of long for me, but I would imagine these are made more for men's feet so I really can't complain that much. Overall, these are really nice!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla D.

customer_reviews.title: I can only imagine that these chin guards would be a great addition to a serious martial artist/kickboxing athlete
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means a strong martial artist. In fact I am over 60 yrs old and took up kickboxing for exercise. We do hit a bag with a plastic pole in the center and after constant use wore a little thin and started to do a job on my foot and chin. These chin guards allow me to put my hip into my kicks without worrying about my chins and feet. For my use these guards are phenomenal. I can only imagine that these chin guards would be a great addition to a serious martial artist/kickboxing athlete.
customer_reviews.author: James Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great fitment for 5’ - 9” to 5’ - 10”!
customer_reviews.text: I had rev gear shin guards and they are too bulky and heavy. Then I tried the tanpeki hayabusa shin guards and they don’t provide enough padding. (but good for shin conditioning.) Then I bought a pair of Windy shin guards but I bought a size too big. So I purchased a pair of these medium sized shin guards and they fit perfectly! Throwing kicks to the head is a lot easier because they are lighter. And they form around my leg better. Just make sure you tighten them down all the way because they can rotate slightly when hard sparring. Happy Teeping!
customer_reviews.author: Owen Owen's.

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove!
customer_reviews.text: These guards are great they stay put and seem to be built very solidly. I’m 5’8 245 pounds muslce/fat but legs are about average size and the large fits perfect. So far Fairtex gear has not let me down, it all seems to be built very well.
customer_reviews.author: isaias

customer_reviews.title: Great shinguards for kickboxing/muay thai
customer_reviews.text: Great shinguards for kickboxing/muay thai. They are a little bulkier than I would like for MMA but they work. The straps keep the shinguards in place very well and the padding is sufficient. I am 6' 170lbs and I bought a size L. The height of the guard is perfect. The higher of the two velcro straps is much konger than needed for my skinny calves and the extra few inches of strap just dangle. However this has been a non-issue because the velcro is strong enough that the straps don't peel open if the excess strap gets hit.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy shin guards
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shin guards. The brand came recommended by my Muay Thai coach, and I'm glad I went with Fairtex. They fit really well (I'm 5'2 and got a small) and I can kick and block pretty hard with them on, but I don't wear them when I work out with a bag. The only thing is that my coach mentioned that sometimes Fairtext guards come with some sort of coating on them that causes minor allergic reactions when you wear them, but that didn't happen with me. I have no complaints with these guards, and I think they'll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Casey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I've had two pairs of these. The only issue I've had is the sizing. My first were XL, and while every other brand of XL shin guards fit fine, these did not fit around the calf. I had to order a XXL later (just used tape to use the XL for awhile). The XXL fits well, but do feel a little bit like wearing a mascot leg costume. It could be my body size/comp that is the issue. All that said, they work great for saving my shins during good rounds.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth c dunbar

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, but I need to return them.
customer_reviews.text: Fairtex makes solid equipment. These shin guards, like their gloves, are very well constructed. But like their gloves, these guards just don't fit right. The padding is great, but they do not stay put very well. I find myself constantly adjusting them. If I tighten too tight, they cut off my blood flow. I am 5'9" with 14" shins. I ordered the mediums, according to the sizing chart.
customer_reviews.author: DRod

customer_reviews.title: Great value and great protection!
customer_reviews.text: Great shin guards for the money! Good protection, great quality, well made. However I only gave it 4 stars because as previously mentioned the back strap can leave some friction burns during training, for me it doesn’t always happen and it never happens if I wear An ankle brace, With the ankle brace you don’t even feel the back strap, it’s the most comfortable way to wear these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tears up ankles, protects shins
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic for shin protection but the ankle straps will tear up the back of your ankles. The attached photo is from a single one-hour training session! If you still want to buy these, consider purchasing a thin ankle wrap to protect your skin.
customer_reviews.author: DavidOfTheAmazon

customer_reviews.title: these offer very good protection and I love that it covers up to ...
customer_reviews.text: Absorbs impmact well and stays in place for the most part. I haven't worn a pair of shin guards that doesn't shift after a while, but then again I haven't paid over $80 for yet either. For the price, these offer very good protection and I love that it covers up to the knee. Also easy to put on without having to take off shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly don't cheap out and buy subpar gear like I did at first with sanabul gear. These are much higher quality, and they stay where they are supposed to with a extra stap at the ankle and heavy duty straps. Padding is excellent and protects better than cheaper shin gaurds.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: YES!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great length, durability, quality, design and pretty good protection. The only issue I had was that it caused a severe itch on my shins/calves for the 1st 10-15 times I used them. I sat them out in the sun, and I think I've broken them in. They are perfect now and the side straps are strong and hold well. Not much slippage and very comfortable. I love these!
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Brown

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, comfortable, and stays in place.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, comfortable, and stays in place. Only thing I don't like is they absorb sweat as opposed to drying quickly. But these are definitely a must buy if you are looking for good affordable guards. We bang pretty hard in training and these hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Rio

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Please do not think these are going to stop you from feeling impact from the person you are training with. They do help soften the blow. My bottom right strap does not fit as well anymore, but the top strap does very well holding it in place. Velcro is not annoying and these are pretty comfortable. Make sure you air dry and wipe down after usage. They will hold onto odors if you do not properly maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Ichya Paradise

customer_reviews.title: Great shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and the straps are comfortable, the only issue that i have is that they still move around if use with full leggings, so you need to use them with shorts!! Also I wish the straps were a little longer since I have big calfs. I'm 5'2 and order small and they cover perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Chayrelm

customer_reviews.title: Nice gear
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff , quality made. Protects shins of both me and partner. One complaint is the tip of foot guard will slap your toes on kicks which can be painful after awhile, but then again it's Muay Thai so pain and discomfort is the name of the game.
customer_reviews.author: TCT

customer_reviews.title: Rash
customer_reviews.text: I bought my husband these shin guards back in May 2019 he nearly got time to go to the gym last week and he broke out in a rash all around where the shin guard touches his skin. I hope they can exchange or credit me paid good money for these
customer_reviews.author: Monica Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Get these!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn a few pairs of shin guards into the ground drilling and sparring through the years. These are by far the best so far, they are light weight, good sturdy coverage, and comfortable. Time will tell if they are well built but I think they'll hold!
customer_reviews.author: Peter LaCorte

customer_reviews.title: Great shin guards for a good price
customer_reviews.text: These are great shin guards for the price! I upgraded to these and am very Happy! The only con is what other people have mentioned before which is the lack of padding where the foot pad meets the actual shin guard, not a big issue. This product is remarkably light weight for all the padding and a great shin guard for kick boxing sparring! You forget that you are actually wearing shin guards!
customer_reviews.author: Roy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality shin pads
customer_reviews.text: Great quality shin pads, my only issue with these is that the way the knee protection is designed it makes it hard to throw knees at your opponent because the shin guard convers above the knee. Still 5 stars, I have been using these for 3-4 months and they have held up great. You can never go wrong with Fairtex!
customer_reviews.author: John Almeida

customer_reviews.title: Purchased right before coronavirus started
customer_reviews.text: I was psyched to use these for my new muay thai class. They fit well, take a blow, and look bad-ass. It's a shame that a cough to the face is more deadly than a kick to the body nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Far and away the best shin guards I’ve ever used. I simply put them on and never have to adjust them. They are so comfortable and in no way hinder my mobility. Thry offer great protection for checking kicks and gnarly shin collisions all for a decent price as well.
customer_reviews.author: JUICE

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love them, I've used them for a couple of sparring sessions and so far I love them. I haven't experienced any rash on the back of my legs like some people complained about
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shin protectors!!!
customer_reviews.text: Shin protectors were recived on time and are of outstanding quality. There are no obvious manufacturing flaws, the stitching is great with no loose threads, and the hook and loop fasteners are high quality. The fit is incredible. These are easily the most comfortable shin protectors I have ever owned. I've only used them a few times but so far they stay in place well and provide great protection while not inhibiting mobility or feedback. I will provide an update when I am more familiar with them.
customer_reviews.author: Dignan Zero

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shin guards I have ever used. Superior protection and fit. I don't know why I put up with crappy pads so long.
customer_reviews.author: Economist

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic Shin Guards
customer_reviews.text: They might look a little "large" when you put them on but they are extremely comfortable, very lightweight and offer great protection. I sweat like crazy and have never had them slip or shift when I'm sparring. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great shin guards, fit just right, comfortable, light, and provide protection needed to train.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES these... I got them for his birthday and he hasn't been happier in Muay Thai
customer_reviews.author: Christina da Silva

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me safe.
customer_reviews.text: Coming off surgery on both legs last year, so my legs are still sensitive, these pads keeps me worried about training and not worried about injuries. Would recommend. I use them for MMA Striking classes
customer_reviews.author: Chris Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for about a few months.. seem to be holding up pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Smith

customer_reviews.title: Outdated...buy Venom
customer_reviews.text: Feels like went back in time after wearing Venom pads. Returned... bought Venom...so much more comfortable I don’t care if they don’t last 10 years
customer_reviews.author: armen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: XL was a little big so we returned for L. My husband is 200lbs, 5'11" and has decent size calves. He loves them and uses them regularly. So far so good. No wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G.

customer_reviews.title: Great battle tested gear
customer_reviews.text: Obviously these are top quality guards, I was happy to find them at such an affordable price (like $15 -$20 cheaper than at the gym). They don’t move around, they’re comfortable and tough, just a great product. I loved my Anthem ones to death and those were slightly more comfortable but these are a solidly top notch pair. Would recommend to anyone, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for a friend who was just starting Muay Thai training and had purchased another product that didn't fit correctly. He was 70" 289lbs. He absolutely loves these shin guards!! When mine ware out I will be replacing them with a pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: dmack

customer_reviews.title: Bulky
customer_reviews.text: These shin guards came highly recommended, but I found them way too bulky for my needs and returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Inna Z.

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. But this was the ones she wanted. Think she was satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’10” 180 with medium sized calves and medium fits very well. It is very lightweight and is firm when sparring. Material is high quality as well
customer_reviews.author: ponderic sim

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Love my new shin guards! I used to have some sanabul shin guards but they were always falling down or shifting around. I’ve had zero problems with these fairtex shin guards. Super comfy, easy to clean and maintain, and super sexy. I’m 5’2” and I was worried the small wouldn’t be small enough but they fit perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Luisa Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great protection for kicks but falls short
customer_reviews.text: They do protect my shins nicely for kicking. I do not bruise anymore on my shins nor are the sore after a session....But two faults of these shin guards is they slide to the side when I kick and I have to constantly tug them back into place before I can kick again and the bottom strap that goes around your upper ankle rubs really bad against the strap and I have serious friction burn from it. The straps also tend to unvelcro themselves from time to time
customer_reviews.author: korrreena

customer_reviews.title: Solid Shins. Good Fairtex Product
customer_reviews.text: Solid pair of shin guards. I needed some more traditional ones to be able to switch back and forth easier during training. They are pretty good about not turning and the fit is secure. The leather has held up pretty well to this point with no wrinkles, tears, or malfunctions as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: LJ9494

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and durable
customer_reviews.text: I use these for MMA training and these stay in place, don't chafe, and I don't notice them until we're grapppling on the mats.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great padding
customer_reviews.text: Quality product. Takes some getting used to on the toes but worth having.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Murchie

customer_reviews.title: The very best
customer_reviews.text: The best shin gaurds I have purchased. Will buy again. If you haven't tried fairtex you should.
customer_reviews.author: Royal Chapman bee's

customer_reviews.title: LOVE FAIRTEX PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.text: I TRAIN IN MUAY THAI AND MMA AND THESE ARE SIMPLY AMAZING.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY RIVERA

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance 💪
customer_reviews.text: Solid all-around, I would buy these again. These shinguards provide more protection than most other brands. They don't really need to be broken in like leather ones. Be careful not to sinch the bottom strap too tight or they will be uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Boehne

customer_reviews.title: What you’d expect from Fairtex
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Muay Thai shin guards. Superior quality. Durable, comfortable and stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Under the Sun

customer_reviews.title: Durable guards
customer_reviews.text: Finally stopped using sweaty second hand gym shin guards and got my own, do the job, best shin guards you’ll get on a budget
customer_reviews.author: Benji

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good protection
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shin guards. Still look new after almost a year, although i only spar about twice a week. Really good protection, especially when you land shin to shin.
customer_reviews.author: Marty T.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: They move a little bit. No real rubbing from them if I get them positioned right.
customer_reviews.author: C. Neal

customer_reviews.title: These Rule
customer_reviews.text: These Rule. I couldn't ask for a better shinguard, and they're vegan/synthetic.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fogarty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shin Guards
customer_reviews.text: I had used other brands but these shin guards are excellent. They fit right and are light. They also have good patting and can take hard hits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Used this item for the past 3 months of training and I'm impressed by the quality. It hasn't deteriorated at all, and was effective in protecting the shins while remaining lightweight and breathable.
customer_reviews.author: AJA1123

customer_reviews.title: Fairtex Forever
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5’5” , 150 lbs I ordered the large and feel very well protected. They don’t slide sideways on my shin.
customer_reviews.author: new listener

customer_reviews.title: Shin guards
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months of using this product almost everyday they still look brand new. They offer excellent protection for my shins and foot. I’m 5’10 and 140lb. Medium fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Follmar

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: They fit like a glove and absorbed the full shock of kicks, especially against elbows or knee caps. They're also light so they don't slow you down at all. It almost feels like you're not wearing any shin guards. The padding and exterior feels very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Cierra Lundy

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Damaged my ankle skin pretty badly. I dont k ow who is giving 5 stars to these shin guards
customer_reviews.author: Timur

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shin guards. Comfortable and lightweight. Been sparring with them for about a month and a half now and they are holding up well. Can’t speak to durability any further than that
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality shin pads
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Been using for 3 months of sparring and no change since product 1st received. For reference, I bought a small and I’m 5’6” and 120lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Jinn

customer_reviews.title: good fit
customer_reviews.text: lost my old pair so i replaced w these. they hold up well
customer_reviews.author: soo

customer_reviews.title: Muey Thai teacher recommends
customer_reviews.text: My children’s Muey Thai Teacher requested me to buy these shin guards after I bought other shin guards.
customer_reviews.author: AYAKO KAKEHI-WOLF

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Never Shift, Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shin guards. I never have to readjust them, they are comfortable, and I think they will hold up for years. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Phil M

customer_reviews.title: Good protection
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Had it for about a month now and its holding up nicely. Quality gear! Im 5’2 125 so i got a size small and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Can't ever go wrong with fairtex. What an amazing deal for these shin guards. I absolutely recommend these. Just threw tons of kicks to the bag today and feel 0 pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Super thick and great protection
customer_reviews.text: Super thick and great protection!!!! Very vedy comfrtable and i like that they have a heel strap to keep them in place
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality, Good price
customer_reviews.text: The shin guards are comfortable and offer good protection. The price is amazing for the quality, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Correnti

customer_reviews.title: Best shin gear I own.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite shin gear I've had. They fit better than the other brands, they don't impede my movement and they have a good about of padding, perfect for sparring.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: They are really good. They do exactly what they are designed to ...
customer_reviews.text: They are really good. They do exactly what they are designed to do; protect your shins and your partner. I've had them for about 5 months and not a sign of wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product. Fits well and stays in place fairly well. Good value. Size large fits ( 6’1” 170). Shipping was super fast too.
customer_reviews.author: Grant A

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these shin guards is great. I'm a muay thai fighter and during our fight camps these can handle SERIOUS kicks/checks
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Compton

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Good protection and fit great the only downfall is they would fall off my feet once in a while without tape
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great Gear
customer_reviews.text: Stay on very well. I was a little worried about size because my calves are so large, but fit fine. Great quality synthetic.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Hase

customer_reviews.title: it really protects
customer_reviews.text: just got into Striking and my trainer told me THESE!!! and i love them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perform well and great fit
customer_reviews.text: This product was a perfect fit very little shifting around when checking and throwing kicks nice compact , light and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur DuPont jr

customer_reviews.title: Good comfort and protection. They don't slide off.
customer_reviews.text: I've been happy with these shinguards. Have had pretty good protection for sparring and have yet to slide off or slip to the side.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Feel very solid. A little uncomfortable at first, ...
customer_reviews.text: Feel very solid. A little uncomfortable at first, but they are definetly starting to break in.
customer_reviews.author: WildGoose

customer_reviews.title: Half order missing
customer_reviews.text: I just opened my package and received one guard just the right
customer_reviews.author: Ryan3000

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They move a little more than I'd like but the protection is top-notch.
customer_reviews.author: guillaume debernis

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for one of my students and she loved them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they are awesome quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. My kickboxing instructor wasn't sure if they were a knock-off Fairtex item or not (a fruit company shipped them to me). I don't care either way. If they are a knock-off, they are awesome quality for the price! Don't hesitate to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set of shin guards I’ve gotten many training rounds out of the Already and they’re still like new
customer_reviews.author: Alex Broach

customer_reviews.title: True Fairtex
customer_reviews.text: Light and comfortable, good side protection too. Velcro closures snugly embraced calves.
customer_reviews.author: Vit

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit, annoying ok the knee.
customer_reviews.text: Great on leg, a bit annoying when touches the knee.
customer_reviews.author: Khalid Zeinab

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, fits great and i could really move around and they stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Get them
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I’m 6ft, 210, got mediums. Fit like a glove 🔥
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit
customer_reviews.text: Got back into muay thai and these shins are excellent. great fit and build quality
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great product A+
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shin guards, fits and protects great. You will be happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Muhamed Rizvanovic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Price, Comfort, Look ... fit great .. snug/tight/solid..fast shipping A++++
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Can’t count
customer_reviews.text: Received 1 shinguard. Last I knew most are born with 2 legs. Goos job!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: kick ass
customer_reviews.text: Fit is perfect and full protection. Light weight and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: James Gillis

customer_reviews.title: Snug
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 6’3, 190 pound male and the XL fits me nice
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent delivery timeframe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent delivery timeframe. I received them exactly on the expected delivery date. This brand of shin guards were highly recommended by a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly. I’m 5’6 and got a medium. Took two days to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: kirk gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gear
customer_reviews.text: Great fit! I’m 6’2 190lbs the large fits just right!
customer_reviews.author: Hugo

customer_reviews.title: after trying several brands these are his favorite.
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old son loves these, after trying several brands these are his favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Buss

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great padding, can't feel much when I block a kick and surprisingly light. Also, they arrived really fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Fairtex Competition Muay Thai Shin Guards, SP5 - Black, Blue, Yellow, Red
product_meta.description: These Muay Thai Shinguards have been re-designed to eliminate all metal fixtures and rough edges. They are lightweight, durable, and provide complete protection for both the shin and instep. This complete re-design makes them perfect for both competition, and sparring. Hook and loop pull strap provides a secure fit. Durable synthetic leather shell. Shock-absorbing, high-density foam core. Extended instep for greater foot protection. Handmade in Thailand.
feature_bullets: Size Height / Weight Small: Under 5'3" (Up to 135lbs.) Medium 5'3" - 5'10" or (136 - 160lbs.) Large 5'10" - 6'1" or (161 - 215lbs.) XLarge 6'1" - 6'4" or (over 216lbs.)
#1 Muay Thai brand proven through quality and durability
Shinguards protect your knee and foot while wrapping partially around the upper part of your calves
